content: Good morning!!! Are you okay?
You remember your codename right?
Amazing! Welcome back to the real world ${name}. The tests went fine.
I am glad you are back alive.
Yes, I know! I am the amazing inventor of the Pixinator!
You don’t remember my great invention, the Pixinator?
ALERT! ALERT! ALERT!
Bad news. We have evidence that our enemy SilentSpectra has decrypted our data again.
No way! I even made our encryption algorithm more complex!
Good for you.
Let me cry in the corner for a second…
When I want to send a message to you, I encrypt my message first with the public key that you shared with me.
This encrypted message is unreadable, even for myself. This is the cipher text, which I send over the network.
When you receive my message, you are the only one who can decrypt the message.
That is because only you have the private key that can decrypt this cipher text.
This is, of course, assuming that the public key you shared with me belongs to your private key...
… and that you never shared your private key with anyone. I mean, just keep it private!
Let’s move to the control room to discuss this matter.
Okay, back to the topic my people.
The how and what don't matter. What matters is that we are in big trouble now.
Our sources think that SilentSpectra has access to a super fast computer capable of cracking our secret keys.
You mean a quantum computer?
I don’t know.

choices.text: Why can’t we decrypt their communication?

content: Well… our sources haven’t been able to find any suspicious communication at all.
Their interactions on social media seem fairly normal, for example.
The good news is that we have tracked down and detained Agent P., who seems to be working for SilentSpectra.
We have secured his hideout too. I will interrogate him to see whether he has some information.
${name}, I want you to search his room for clues.
Dr. Glitchwell, you stay on standby in case ${name} needs you to analyse something.
Yes ma’am!
What do you want to wait for?

choices.text: I need to go to the toilet
I need a cup of coffee first
I want to play Pokémon Go

content: I did not want to hear that.
Dr. Glitchwell, is drowsiness one of the side effects of your tests?
You know I pay you well enough to just do your job!
Just go to Agent P.’s hideout now.
Okay, I have arrived at Agent P.’s hideout.
I should call Dr. Glitchwell whenever I am ready. What should I investigate?
I see two images… What could that possibly mean?
But why would one picture be altered?
How lovely, I like sunrises too!
Do I understand what is written here?

choices.text: No, what does this diagram mean?
Yes, the diagram speaks for itself

content: I'm getting a call...
Hello ${name}! You haven’t called me yet, so I got worried. What’s up?
So, you're having trouble understanding a diagram you found… Let me see…
This diagram shows that a hidden message can be combined with a carrier and a stego key.
I assume the carrier will be some kind of data object on a computer, such as a PDF, MP3, or an image.
The key will probably be used so that others cannot uncover the secret message easily.
All this data seems to be combined into one object. I think that object will be sent over a certain medium…
Welp, I need to go! Boss M. calls me.
There is also a newspaper article in the bin, about images appearing on eBay containing steganography.
That’s a surprise!
Agent P. has quite some books. Let’s look into them.
Hm… The first book is about the difference between steganography and cryptography.
Also, on the right side an example of hiding a message with the help of lemon juice is shown.
On the next page, an example of a secret message using cryptography.
The second book is a history book.
It shows how a slave was used as a cover to hide a secret message which was tattooed on the slave’s scalp.
The last book shows that terrorists use steganography. It is said that the technique is even used for the 9/11 attacks.
So, steganography is quite important!
Hello ${name}! I am so relieved to hear from you. Are you done investigating?
What have you found?
Then I would like you to clean your room for once!
Yes! Agent P. seems to be particularly interested in steganography.
There must be more than solely cryptography…
I like the wall decoration too!
Bring something I can analyse. I can only analyse one item, otherwise we will not be able to take action in time. Bye!
I will bring…
Okay, I see you have brought the diagram from the bin. Let me have a look…
This diagram shows that a hidden message can be combined with a carrier and a stego key.
I assume the carrier will be some kind of data object on a computer, such as PDF, MP3, or an image.
The key will probably be used so that others cannot uncover the secret message easily.
All this data seems to be combined into one object. I think that object will be sent over a certain medium…
Agent P. seems to be very interested in combining a hidden message with a carrier object.
This must be called steganography! They seem to be using it, but how?
I cannot analyse any further. Please return to Agent P.’s room and bring something useful this time.
Okay, I see you have brought the books from the shelf. That must be heavy! Let me take a look at it…
So, steganography is the art of hiding, which is different to cryptography.
Another book is about the history of steganography.
It seems it has had its uses in a non-digital world as well.
But also, it has been part of a major history event.
Agent P. seems to be very interested in this topic, but with just this information I cannot proceed.
Please return to Agent P.’s room and bring something useful this time.
Okay, I see you have brought the two images from the computer. What would you like me to analyse?
The file size seems to be exactly the same…
There is no evidence to suggest that these images are suspicious.
The images are both BMP images. Also, the creation date of both images are exactly the same. They seem duplicates.
BMP images store each pixel within the RGBA model (Red, Green, Blue, Alpha).
Alpha is the opacity value. All RGBA values will be combined into one colour pixel.
Is this relevant for steganography?
Let me take a look at the individual bits for both images…
WOAH!!!
The least significant bits seem to differ!
Bits are presented as either 0 or 1. A group of eight bits form a byte, which can represent a decimal value between 0 and 255.
The rightmost bit is the least significant bit, since it adjusts its value minimally.
The byte 10001000 has a decimal value of 136. Let’s change the least significant bit.
10001000 changed to 10001001, because the most right bit is the least significant bit.
The value of 10001001 is 137, so if this byte represented the colour red, we have only changed its value slightly.
In contrast: if we would have adjusted 10001000 to 00001000, its value would have been 8.
If this byte represented the red colour, the colour would have drastically changed!
When we line up each byte's least significant bit, I can see some characters.
Let’s say the number 1 is ‘a’, and the number 26 is ‘z’, then we can read a word in the right picture!
I assume this is the simple protocol that Agent P. came up with.
If he used a stego key to randomize which least significant bits are used, we would not be able to have read this message.
I guess that is why Agent P. highlighted ‘stego key’ in the diagram he threw away…
He has not implemented a stego key yet. This gives us opportunities!
By the way, what do you think Agent P. is using this steganography for?
Good observation! That may also explain why we haven’t seen SilentSpectra communicating yet.
Maybe they hide their secret messages within their images on social media!
But maybe they embed malicious code within the images too.
MAYBE WE'VE BEEN HACKED…
And they're stealing our private keys through a malicious code embedded within an image…
And then they use images to send our stolen private keys back to them.
They never needed a quantum computer to decrypt our messages over and over again…
Our Intrusion Detection System would have never suspected an image to contain our private keys…

choices.text: What is an Intrusion Detection System?

content: Our Intrusion Detection System scans our network traffic for malicious activity.
But if the activity is hidden within an image, our system does not detect that (yet).
I need to do research on this topic to prevent attacks using steganography.
MAYBE WE'VE BEEN HACKED…
And they're stealing our private keys through a malicious code embedded within an image…
And then they use images to send our stolen private keys back to them.
They never needed a quantum computer to decrypt our messages over and over again…
Our Intrusion Detection System would have never suspected an image to contain our private keys…

choices.text: What is an Intrusion Detection System?

content: Our Intrusion Detection System scans our network traffic for malicious activity.
But if the activity is hidden within an image, our system does not detect that (yet).
I need to do research on this topic, to prevent these attacks using steganography.
That reminds me…
Maybe SilentSpectra hides their secret messages within their images on social media!
That may also explain why we haven’t seen SilentSpectra communicating yet.
${name}, please find the hidden message of this part of the image. Dr. Glitchwell, you do the other part.
What word did you find?
There is no way that correlates with my finding.
Make sure to concatenate all the least significant bits.
That is where the undetectable secret message is stored.
Please try again.
I found ‘book’. I guess they are using Facebook for their communication!
Let’s call it a day for now and come up with a plan to deal with this issue tomorrow.
Good morning… I worked all night, and I found out that SilentSpectra is indeed using Facebook to communicate.
We have seen their public messages on social media before of course, but we weren’t aware that they integrated any secret messages within the attached files.
Indeed. I also found out that Agent T., who is working for SilentSpectra is using the email adress tom@covinco.com actively.

choices.text: We can perform a DDoS attack

content: Well… we haven’t located their servers yet, so that is not possible.
Uhhh... we haven’t located their main hideout yet, so that will be useless.
What are you suggesting instead?
I suggest we use spear phishing to send an email to Agent T, and hope he will open the attachment in which we will hide Stegware.
Indeed. We can apply Stegware within the attachment of our spear phishing email.
Stegware?
Yes, the name for malicious software which makes use of steganography.
SilentSpectra hacked us in the end. We should…
I was just about to say that!
To do that we need to get into their system and steal their private keys and steganography research.
Additionally, I want to be able to have full control over their system, so that I can shut it down when needed.
Or simply get updates on their progress without them knowing that we’re in.
We will use ${name} and my new invention the Pixinator. You remember waking up earlier from it?
The tests went alright; I can successfully transfer you to the computer world! Let’s move to my lab.
${name}, you will transfer into the computer world and hack into SilentSpectra’s network.
You will literally be the Stegware!
But be careful, if you get caught by their anti-malware and be put into quarantine, you will never be able to get back to the real world.
They used steganography on us! We will use steganography against them!
According to my research, it is very commonly used to get into systems unnoticed. But you will need to do it right.
Listen carefully… The plan is as follows…
In the first place, just like stealing treasure from a museum, you need to get in and out undetected.
To get in, you will need to bypass their security system scanning for malware.
Use steganography to hide yourself, but not fully.
Remember, you ARE the malware, meaning that if a part of you is not visible, you will be stuck hidden forever, because you will never be executed.
The best strategy is to hide yourself completely and have only a small script called a bootstrap that is going to extract you from the object you are hiding in.
Next up is planting a code that polls for images on our account on X.
Indeed. I will post images containing scripts on X. That way, we can control the system from outside.
Here is the seed for the plant. Take good care of it.
Lastly, you should get out of the system safely so you can come back to the real world. Please take some sensitive information with you.
We will not be able to communicate with you once you are in, so you will be on your own.
A beautiful plan isn’t it?
Didn’t you pay attention? Well, here is a recap.
Stay focused!
Dr. Glitchwell, prepare the Pixinator and transfer ${name} to the computer world.
I am on my own now. My choices really matter now.
Phase 1: get in. I am literally data on a computer now.
I need to make sure the anti-malware systems of SilentSpectra cannot find me. I will…
Okay, I have decrypted myself and send an email to Agent T. with myself attached.
Hello, the name is Aegis. I am the Intrusion Detection System for the SilentSpectra network.
You must bypass me to gain access.
I see you are an email, but something encrypted is attached.
I cannot guarantee that you have no means of harm, since I cannot read the encrypted data.
Therefore you will be quarantined!
GAME OVER
Hm… the message within encrypted data is hidden, but the existence of it is not.
Do you want to try again from phase 1 of the final mission?
Which of the following images shall I attach to the email to Agent T.?
An image with a lot of different colours would have worked best, since there we can make use of that redundant information.
But I will try this image anyway.
This image will fit our needs perfectly!
A bigger image can contain more data. It is hard to hide myself in here without altering the visibility of the image.
But I will try this image anyway.
Now that I got an image, I need to hide myself in it.
Where in the image should I hide?

choices.text: At the start of the file
At the end of the file
Replace the most significant bits by me
Replace the least significant bits by me

content: Okay, let’s go!
Hello, the name is Aegis. I am the Intrusion Detection System for the SilentSpectra network.
You must bypass me to gain access.
I see you are an email, with an image attachment.
The image looks highly altered. A lot of redundant data seems to be put together.
Therefore, I cannot guarantee that you have no means of harm.
You will be quarantined!
GAME OVER
Hmm… putting a data object at the very start or end would be very suspicious.
It can easily be detected. I should try to spread the data throughout the file more next time.
How will I hide myself within these most significant bits?

choices.text: I will hide 100% in these bits to be undetectable for their anti-malware system
I will hide 100% in these bits and attach a small readable script that extracts myself

content: Okay, let’s go!
Hello, the name is Aegis. I am the Intrusion Detection System for the SilentSpectra network.
You must bypass me to gain access.
I see you are an email, with an image attachment.
The colours of the image look so weird, as if they are not the right colours.
But maybe that is just a new hype or art trend that I am not aware of.
You are lucky! I will let you through this time.
Phew! I'm through, but it would have been better to hide in the least significant bits of the image…
That way, the colours are (seemingly) not altered as much.
Now I should wait until Agent T. opens the image of the email that I am part of.
Agent T. opened the image but I am still stuck in the image…
Their computer system does not see me, the Stegware, and can thus never execute me…
I am stuck in this image forever, because nothing gets me out.
GAME OVER
Hello, the name is Aegis. I am the Intrusion Detection System for the SilentSpectra network.
You must bypass me to gain access.
I see you are an email, with an image attachment.
The colours of the image look so weird, as if they are not the right colours.
But maybe that is just a new hype or art trend that I am not aware of.
You are lucky! I will let you through this time.
Pfeww! I am through, but I could have better hidden in the least significant bits of the image…
That way, the colours are not altered much.
How will I hide myself within these least significant bits?

choices.text: I will hide 100% in these bits to be undetectable for their anti-malware system
I will hide 100% in these bits and attach a small readable script that extracts myself

content: Okay, let’s go!
Hello, the name is Aegis. I am the Intrusion Detection System for the SilentSpectra network.
You must bypass me to gain access.
I see you are an email, with an image attachment.
I do not see anything suspicious, you may pass through.
Good!
Okay, let’s go!
Hello, the name is Aegis. I am the Intrusion Detection System for the SilentSpectra network.
You must bypass me to gain access.
I see you are an email, with an image attachment.
I do not see anything suspicious, you may pass through.
Good!
Now I should wait until Agent T. opens the attachment, which runs the extract script to extract myself.
Great! Agent T. opened the image and I got extracted. I am fully free in the SilentSpectra network now!
Phase 1 of the mission finished! Now let’s continue to phase 2.
What was phase 2 again?
No, it can’t be. That doesn’t even mean anything.
Yes, I will plant the seed Dr. Glitchwell gave to me.
The script will poll for new pictures on our account on X and download the image.
We will hide commands in these images, so that we can control this system from outside.
Alright, the seed is planted. Let’s enter phase 3 of the mission and get out.
Boss M. told be to bring some sensitive data along. I will bring…

choices.text: Stego research and their private keys

content: Hm… I am not sure if Boss M. will be happy with that data.
Okay, I found this data!
Now, how do I get out?

choices.text: Use steganography to hide myself and the information in a PDF file on the way out
Don’t do anything as the way out of the system is not protected
Use cryptography to hide the sensitive files I'm carrying

content: Hello, the name is Velos. I am the Data Leakage Protection for the SilentSpectra network.
I scan for sensitive data patterns, like credit card numbers and other sensitive data.
I see some private keys are in your possession, but the context is never right to let them out.
Therefore, you may not leave this system!
Hello, the name is Velos. I am the Data Leakage Protection for the SilentSpectra network.
I scan for sensitive data patterns, like credit card numbers and other sensitive data.
You are completely encrypted. I can therefore not guarantee that you are carrying sensitive data.
So, you may not leave this system!
GAME OVER
Hm… I need to outsmart Velos, the Data Leakage Protection.
Hello, the name is Velos. I am the Data Leakage Protection for the SilentSpectra network.
I scan for sensitive data patterns, like credit card numbers and other sensitive data.
You seem to be an unharmful PDF file that is going to be uploaded on the internet.
That is no weird action. Agent P. probably just wants to share something.
I will let you through.
Great! I got out of the system and I am free on the internet now.
Have you found ${name} already?
No, I haven’t. It seems that ${name} is stuck in the system. I cannot get them out.
He will not wake up now from by Pixinator.
We have lost our hero. May ${name} rest in peace.
Amazing! I have found ${name} on the internet. I will transfer him back to life now.
Congratulations! You have made it back alive.
I see you brought some sensitive data that I wanted to see along. Good job!
We will now be able to fully control SilentSpectra.
Yep, and I have upgraded our system security with strong StegAnalysis and steganography prevention tools.
We will also not open a suspicious attachment of an email anymore.
You are a real steganography master!
The end.
